subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|もり|yomi=k}}
The {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|守る|tr=moru||to protect, to watch over}}. Also spelled with the [[okurigana]] {{ja-l|り}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|まもり|yomi=k}}
The {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|守る|tr=mamoru||to protect}}. Also spelled with the [[okurigana]] {{ja-l|り}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Synonyms
Noun
Etymology 7
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|かみ|yomi=k}}
From the sense of being ''above'' in rank and status. Essentially of the same meaning as {{m|ja|上|tr=kami||above}}, but spelled {{lang|ja|守}} to convey a sense of “[[watch]]ing” or “[[oversee]]ing”.  This spelling is an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]] or [[ateji]] used for the [[meaning]].

subSections.title: Noun
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|こう|hhira=かう}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=こう|obsolete}} see ''kami'' above; used in obsolete titles
